source.instructions: Look at the image on the left. What type of encryption does this represent?

source.name: Q2
source.text: You send a <<<public key>>> to someone who should an encrypted file back to you. When you get this file back, you use a <<<private key>>> to decrypt it. The AES encryption uses a <<<password>>> to encrypt a file.

answers.answer: This is a key generated by the Caesar Cipher
It is used by a symmetric encryption algorithm
I would send this to someone to whom I want to send an encrypted file
I would use this to encrypt a file I send to someone else
It is used by an asymmetric encryption algorithm

source.name: Q4
source.instructions:
You should now run this program to encrypt the message using the password *friday* and create an encrypted file called `mangled.txt`.

When you think you have done it right, press the button below.
